dataModel

Class SiteFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataModel.SiteFormat

  • public class SiteFormat
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents all of the format information in an Excel sheet that is needed to parse items and their attributes from an HTML document. It parses this information from a given excel file. It also handles the first stage of parsing of the HTML.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SiteFormat(java.sql.Connection con, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Seller> existingSellers, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,AttributeName> existingAttributeNames, java.io.File excelSheet)
      This constructor loads a SiteFormat from a given excel spreadsheet file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SiteFormat

        public SiteFormat(java.sql.Connection con,
          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Seller> existingSellers,
          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,AttributeName> existingAttributeNames,
          java.io.File excelSheet)
           throws SiteFormatException
        This constructor loads a SiteFormat from a given excel spreadsheet file. If the SiteFormat contains a new seller or new Attribute names these will be saved to the database.
        Parameters:
        con - The database connection to be used
        existingSellers - A Map relating seller names to Seller objects for all existing sellers
        existingAttributeNames - A Map relating attribute names to AttributeName objects for all existing AttributeName
        excelSheet - the file containing the SiteFormat data
        Throws:
        SiteFormatException - if the given file does not parse correctly
